poem:
### The Edge of Red 

In streets sweeping clean  
of warmth, numbers strip  
from bone cold welfare—  
Three million echoes  
shiver thinly,  
as the sky folds  
into pockets lightened  
of hope's rare coin.  

Dark wings brush  
beyond windows  
naked of curtains,  
poverty's quiet shadow  
stumbles through doors.
